poem:
Title: Triumph in the Thames' Shadow

Edged in ink, the tale unfolds,
Khan, repeated victory's brand,
Sunday paper's message, told.
As sceptics jeer, his Sceptre's hand 
Flies over London's fretful heart,
Pulse quickened by the ballot's peal.
"Thank you," voiced as speeches start,
In echoed gratitude we feel.
In clime of clatter, scribed in dirt,
A third term spun, his promise sealed.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sadiq Khan elected London mayor for third term in further boost for Labour Sadiq Khan has been elected mayor of London, winning a historic third term after a dramatic contest. Khan was declared the winner over the Conservative candidate, Susan Hall, on Saturday afternoon, with 43.8% of the vote. The London mayor was booed as he began his victory speech. “Thank you from the bottom of my heart, thank you, London,” he told an audience". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
